pub_created_display: Ardashir I (224 to 240), Drachm, Group / Mint B ("Hamadan")
issue_place_s: Group / Mint B ("Hamadan"), Media, Sasanian Empire
issue_obverse_figure_description_s: crown cap edged with a double row of pearls, symbol in the center of lateral field, surrounded by zigzag design, inner double row of pearls; diadem, pendent diadem ribbons; cheek-flaps; tunica with two cross-like devices; row of pearls on neck-cutout
issue_obverse_legend_s: 11 h .l. o. mzdysn bgy 'rthštr-MRKAn MRKA 'ry'n| mazdēsn bay Ardašir šāhān šāh Ērān|"the Mazda-worshiping, divine Ardashir, King of Kings of the Iranians"
issue_reverse_figure_description_s: base consisting of two elements; round altar shaft; four altar slabs; altar flames depicted with vertical strokes; to the left and right mushroom-shaped bases supporting lion-paw structures; below left and right edge of altar table pendent diadem ribbon
issue_reverse_legend_s: 11 h.l. o. NWRA ZY- 3 h l. a. 'rthštr | ādur ī Ardašīr | “the fire of Ardashir”
